list_definition.definition: to be interested in having or doing, or to wish to have or do (something); to desire

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She wants to know where he is
This wall wants a coat of paint.
This house wants none of the usual modern features, but I do not like it
The people will want (= be poor) no longer.
The child has a long list of wants.
They have lived in want for many years.
There’s no want of opportunities these days.

list_ex_of_english: She too wants to participate in the creation of a person.
Studying resources can therefore be helpful if one wants to understand the evolution of business-government relations over time.
The women still wanted to address local conflict, but in addition the group turned more and more into a social, mutual support network.
We wanted to be finished one way or the other.
Another of the detainees was wanted for an assassination attempt on a local employer.
We were deeply touched that you cared enough to ask us about what we wanted and why we wanted it.
At the outset of the 1990s, there was remarkable consensus within the business community as to what kind of political economy it wanted.
They just wanted to make money on us, nothing else.
